description: From Ancient Greek κυκλικός (kuklikós). Possibly from cycle +‎ -ic.

adjectives.description: cyclic (comparative more cyclic, superlative most cyclic)

entries.meaning: Characterized by, or moving in cycles, or happening at regular intervals.
examples: The weather had a cyclic pattern of rain and sun.

entries.meaning: (chemistry, of a compound) Having chains of atoms arranged in a ring.
examples: Benzene and cyclohexane are both cyclic compounds.

entries.meaning: (botany) Having parts arranged in a whorl.
(mathematics, of a group) Being generated by only one element.
(geometry, of a polygon) Able to be inscribed in a circle.
(firearms, of an automatic weapon) Firing at its full cyclic rate.
(aviation) The flight control used to control a helicopter's direction and rate of horizontal movement by tilting the lift vector of the helicopter's main rotor disk.
